description.narrative: Improved access to housing finance: IFC anticipates that the Project will contribute to the increase in access to housing finance in Turkey, as 100% of the use of proceeds will be allocated for residential mortgages. Improved access to green housing finance: IFC anticipates that the Project will contribute to the increase in access to green housing finance in Turkey, as up to $35 million of the use of proceeds potentially will be allocated specifically for green mortgage loans.

The proposed project aims to provide a financing of up to US$100 million to Turkiye Is Bankasi A.S. (Isbank or the Bank), the largest private bank in Turkey and a long-standing IFC client, through an investment in Diversified Payment Rights (DPR) notes to be issued under Isbanks existing DPR program. The proceeds of IFCs investment would provide long-term financing to support Isbanks financing of residential mortgage loans to individuals in Turkey, with potentially up to US$35 million to be earmarked for green mortgages (the Project).
